Nicolai Kraus has two postdoc positions in (homotopy) type theory available. The positions are initially for three years, after which an extension is likely to be possible. The suggested starting date is 1 October this year, but it is possible to start later. Please get in touch with Nicolai if you want to discuss possible start dates!

The official advert is here, and the closing date is 25 July. Please note that the university's application form is somewhat non-standard. There are very subject-specific questions (for example, asking you to demonstrate your experience with proof assistants) and text fields, but no obvious places to upload a CV or cover letter. You may use Section 5 ("additional information") to include the information you would usually add in a CV or cover letter. Please do not be discouraged by the subject-specific questions; it is not necessary to have experience with everything. Also note that the university asks for referee details per default; you do not need letters at the time you apply, you only need to list their contact details at this stage. Members of underrepresented groups are particularly encouraged to apply.

If you are interested, please get in touch with Nicolai.
